definition: to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: The children were making too much noise, and he faced them down.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们喧闹不堪，他板起面孔把他们镇住了。

sentences.english: Everyone was really startled by what he said last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚他真是出语惊人，把人们当场镇住了。

sentences.english: When you have been amazing things curb, you would not dare not obedient.
sentences.chinese: 当你被神奇的东西镇住时，你是不敢不听话的。

sentences.english: The two boxers glowered each other to squelch the other.
sentences.chinese: 两位拳击手凶狠地互相瞪着眼想以此镇住对方。

sentences.english: Princess Aurora is under a magic spell.
sentences.chinese: 爱洛公主被魔咒镇住了。

sentences.english: Who is under a magic spell?
Sirens in the distance caused them all to stop.
sentences.chinese: 远处的警笛声把他们都镇住了。

sentences.english: The princess is under a magic spell.
She was smothered by his despotic power.
A hex is believed to be an evil spell that is put on someone.
sentences.chinese: 背运据说是指被人用咒语镇住了。

definition: to manage to suppress/to keep under control
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
to subdue/to force to capitulate/to reduce to submission/to soothe
